Package net.viktorc.pp4j.api

Interface ProcessManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Resettable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractProcessManager, JavaProcessManager, SimpleProcessManager
    public interface ProcessManager
extends Resettable
    An interface that defines methods that allow for the definition and management of a process. It includes methods that start the process, determine and handle its startup behavior, and allow for its orderly termination. The same instance may be used for the management of multiple subsequent processes, thus the implementation should allow for reusability or rely on the Resettable.reset() method to clear its state.
    Author:
    Viktor Csomor

      • Methods inherited from interface Resettable

        reset

    • Method Detail

      • start

        Process start()
       throws IOException
        Starts a new process. The process created should always be the same and it should always be started only upon the call of this method.
        Returns:
        A new process.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the process cannot be started.

      • getEncoding

        Charset getEncoding()
        Returns the character set to use to communicate with the managed process through its standard streams.
        Returns:
        The character set to use when reading from and writing to the process' streams.

      • startsUpInstantly

        boolean startsUpInstantly()
        Determines whether the process should be considered started up instantly or if it is only started up once a certain output is printed to its standard out or standard error streams. If it returns true, the process is immediately considered started up and ready as soon as it starts running. If it returns false, the method isStartedUp(String, boolean) determines when the process can be considered started up.
        Returns:
        Whether the process can be considered started up and ready for submissions immediately after it starts.

      • isStartedUp

        boolean isStartedUp​(String outputLine,
                    boolean error)
             throws FailedStartupException
        Handles the output of the process after its launch. The return value of the method determines whether the process is to be considered started up and ready for submissions. It is only ever called if startsUpInstantly() returns false.
        Parameters:
        outputLine - A line of output produced by the process.
        error - Whether this line was output to the standard error or the standard out stream.
        Returns:
        Whether the process is to be considered started up.
        Throws:
        FailedStartupException - If the output signals a process failure and the process is not expected to recover.

      • getKeepAliveTime

        Optional<Long> getKeepAliveTime()
        Determines the duration of continuous idleness after which the process is to be terminated. The process is considered idle if it is started up and not processing a submission.
        Returns:
        The number of milliseconds of continuous idleness after which the process is to be terminated.

      • getInitSubmission

        Optional<Submission<?>> getInitSubmission()
        Returns an optional submission to execute upon the startup the process. No other submissions are to be accepted until this submission is processed. If the returned optional is empty, no initial submission is executed.
        Returns:
        The optional initial submission that is for setting up the process for later submissions.

      • getTerminationSubmission

        Optional<Submission<?>> getTerminationSubmission()
        Returns an optional submission for terminating the process. It allows for an opportunity to execute commands to close resources or to exit the process in an orderly way. If the returned optional is empty, the process is killed forcibly.
        Returns:
        The optional termination submission for shutting down the process.

      • onStartup

        default void onStartup()
        A callback method invoked after the process starts up and the initial submission, if there is one, is executed.

      • onTermination

        default void onTermination​(int returnCode)
        A callback method invoked after the process terminates. Its main purpose is to allow for wrap-up activities.
        Parameters:
        returnCode - The return code of the terminated process.
